Articles.Content: I dont think there is a conflict I had a clear veiw of a sporatic flashing like that made a roughly spherical shape over minmus when no planet or ship was even remotly close. The first circle on the right having a blueish tint would indicate to me that that is minmus and the object could be in geo sync orbit and or the line means that we need to be in line with kerbin for the orbit. I am most likely wrong but to me those cirles look like minmus and ike the third bieng unknown.

IMHO there isn't nearly enough detail available in the image to draw conclusions like that. If someone could manage to decompile whatever game file the sound source is in, and feed the original through an SSTV decoder and skip a few A/D conversions, it might get 'slightly' more clear. However.. due to the nature of SSTV, it will never be a whole lot better than the best image we have now. (unless a dev chooses to post the original.. which is unlikely)

I certainly hope whoever came up with the image originally understood the limitations of SSTV and weren't expecting fine details like subtle shading differences, to be able to survive the encode/decode process.
I saw one of those Mun Archs when I was orbiting the mun yesterday. Forgot to take a picture of it though but I was pretty happy finding my first easter egg.

Qumefox I agree that there is not enough info but what is givin is a clue and the coloring values would indicate a bluish tint on the top of the three right circles. im going to shut up now and see how this thread contenues.
I mean, I could give you the original .png file of the image, but that's not as fun
